page.title: 09ST. Nicholas Chuch,Gt.Kimble
page.content: St. Nicholas is an old church in a rural setting. There are 38 stained glass windows of all shapes and sizes.The organ has 23 pipes and they are probably made of tin or steel. There are 6 bells and 50 pews which could hold about 120 people (approx). The oldest grave, which still has writing, dates back to 1830 and belongs to Sir Bernard Mortland and the pub across the road, The Bernard Arms, could be named after him. Gt. Kimble has a tower with 6 bells which will express high or low notes at the pull of the ropes. The roof is made of oak beams and the pulpit was given to the parish by Ann Murray. Also there is a brass framed picture of The Madonna which dates back to 1282. {Above all this is a very beautiful church.}
